Award.AwardTitle: Aspiring Computer Systems Research (CSR) PIs Workshop

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
This objective of this award is to organize the inaugural Aspiring Principal Investigator (PI) meeting for Computer Systems Research (CSR). The workshop will assemble a group of aspiring CSR PIs with diverse backgrounds, fostering the growth of the CSR community. Participants interested in computer systems research, but who have not received funding from the program, will have a better understanding of the CSR program and prepare them for developing competitive CSR proposals in the future. A number of PIs will be selected from HBCU/MEI and under-represented groups. The workshop is to be held at the National Science Foundation (NSF) Headquarters in Alexandria, VA on Friday, May 11, 2018. The format will include presentations of information of CSR related solicitations, talks by recent CSR awardees, and a session to discuss the NSF panel review process, including discussion of traits of successful CSR proposals.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 2018 NSF Workshop for Aspiring Principal Investigators (PIs) in Computer Systems Research (CSR) was held on Friday May 11th, 2018 at the National Science Foundation. The goal of the event was to bring together a group of researchers who were interested in computer systems research, but lacked prior CSR experiences. 

 

This one-day workshop was very successful and was attended by about 80 faculty members from 28 states, with diverse backgrounds and representing different institutions.

 

The workshop consisted of the presentations by recent CSR awardees and CSR program directors, as well as some discussion sessions. The awardees presented their experiences on applying for and working on CSR projects. In particular, they shared the lessons they learned over the years, as well as the process they used to develop the initial research idea, devise potential solutions, and write the full proposal. NSF CSR program directors presented the CSR programs and answered the questions from the workshop participants.

 

The event provided a valuable opportunity for faculty members to learn more about CSR programs and to interact with CSR program directors. A number of faculty also received travel support to attend this event. 

 

The workshop website is hosted at https://www.seas.gwu.edu/~howie/csr-pi-workshop/. The workshop materials, e.g., presentation slides, have been made available online to the broad community.
